page.title: 04 Bright Pitts & North Lodge
page.content:
Bright Pitts Farm
Mr. Roughton has 2 Mercedes, 2 John Deer, 2 Ford and a Massey tractor and farms about 590 acres. He sprays the fields using Unimogs and has one person working for him called Fred. Mr. Roughton grows winter wheat, barley, oil seed rape, spring beans and oats. Half the winter wheat is used for animal feed (going to Dodson & Horrell) and half for breadmaking. Winter barley goes for feed and malting (Horlicks & malt bread). The crops are rotated at the end of every year. He has two horses and a very big Massey tractor and a combine. He uses three barns with straw and hay in them. He gets up about 7:15am but it depends on the time of year and what the weather is like.
